pullRequest.body:
Introduce type class `BoundedMul`, which allows to generalize multiplication of `BoundedContinuousFunction` to the case where the values are not necessarily in `NonUnitalSeminormedRing`. The most important case for measure theory applications that is allowed by the generalization is bounded continuous functions with values in `ℝ≥0`. The instances of `Monoid` and `SemiRing` on `BoundedContinuousFunction` are correspondingly generalized.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
> Is there a general statement that bounded continuous functions into a suitable object form a semiring, that we should have?

You are right, of course. And a similar observation applies for `Monoid`, `CommMonoid` in addition to `Semiring`. These all seem obviously worth having (for `NNReal`-valued bounded continuous functions in particular). Thank you!

(I struggled a little trying to avoid diamonds with the later `Ring` instance, but everything should hopefully be fine now.)

> > Is there a general statement that bounded continuous functions into a suitable object form a semiring, that we should have?
> 
> (I struggled a little trying to avoid diamonds with the later `Ring` instance, but everything should hopefully be fine now.)

Or I guess this was not a diamond, but rather just non-defeq instances: I had a complaint of the form "inferred Ring.toSemiring is not definitionally equal to instSemiring" for the `Ring` instance of `BoundedContinuousFunction`, if I remember correctly.

To fix the issue, I ended up needing the new lemma `isBounded_pow` and the lemmas in the new `section casts` in `Mathlib.Topology.ContinuousFunction.Bounded`. I hope this was the right way to fix things...

It's still tagged awaiting-author, but it looks good to me.
In case you are happy with the PR and want to merge it,
bors d+
In case there are still things you want to change, you can just ignore this!

:v: kkytola can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

> It's still tagged awaiting-author, but it looks good to me. In case you are happy with the PR and want to merge it, bors d+ In case there are still things you want to change, you can just ignore this!

Thank you for the review and many improvements! I will merge after reading through once more today.
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9150023266/job/25154306443)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9150023266/job/25154306366)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9150023266/job/25154306038)
Is there a general statement that bounded continuous functions into a suitable object form a semiring, that we should have?
The proof looks a little bit too complicated to me. Can you deduce it from properness and continuity of multiplication?

Thanks again for an obvious improvement! I did that.

I did not find an existing `instance ProperSpace ℝ≥0`, however. And when I created one, `#find_home` suggested `Mathlib.Analysis.Normed.Field.Basic`, which does not feel like the right place for the NNReal-specific lemma... The most natural place to look for it would be `Mathlib.Topology.Instance.NNReal`, but I don't think it has sufficient imports. For now, this instance is in the new file `Mathlib.Topology.Bornology.BoundedOperation`, although it feels like a wrong place, too
I'd put it in `Mathlib.Topology.Instances.NNReal`. There is a missing import for that, `import Mathlib.Topology.MetricSpace.Isometry`, but that's definitely a reasonable import.
Could you move this to the section with the general instance on multiplication, as it's a general fact?

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion mul_comm f g := by ext x; simp [mul_apply, mul_comm] ```

```suggestion
  mul f g :=
    { toFun := fun x ↦ f x * g x
      continuous_toFun := f.continuous.mul g.continuous
      map_bounded' := mul_bounded_of_bounded_of_bounded (map_bounded f) (map_bounded g) }
```
Same thing below.

It feels wrong to have a `LipschitzAdd R` here instead of `[BoundedAdd R] [ContinuousAdd R]` (what do you think?) but it can definitely wait for another PR. Maybe add a todo in the corresponding section?

I agree.

However, the addition operation feels less urgent than the multiplication and subtraction, since at least I am not aware of a case where it doesn't work (whereas the lack of subtraction and multiplication have been holding back Riesz-Markov-Kakutani contributions). So this seems like an issue of consistency, which probably does not affect any uses at the moment.

I will add a TODO and make a PR about that consistent design soon, deriving an instance of `BoundedAdd` from `LipschitzAdd`, as that should already cover all existing and planned use cases that I am aware of. I also just realized that I did not use Lipschitzness of subtraction in the BoundedSub instances as I had intended! So I will also include simplifications to instances of `BoundedSub` at the same time.

Just for the record, I am going to address the consistency of the addition instances with the other operations on bounded continuous functions --- I will return to the WIP PR #13035 in the near future. Thank you again for this improvement suggestion!

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: BoundedMul class to generalize multiplication of bounded continuous functions.

source.title: feat(MeasureTheory/Integral): the Riesz-Markov-Kakutani theorem for `Real`-linear functionals
